Question: Shortly before leaving office, in March 1809, this person signed the repeal of the disastrous Embargo.
Hints: In 1779, at the age of thirty-six, this person was elected Governor of Virginia by the two houses of the legislature.
This person was opposed to slavery during his youth, a conviction that became greater throughout his life.
Later in life, Martha **** suffered from diabetes and ill health, and frequent childbirth further weakened her.
